ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No! I swear by the planets with their retrograde motion,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So, I call the receding stars to witness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: No indeed; I swear by the alternating stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I do not need to swear by the orbiting
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So by oath of those that revolve. (The planets.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But nay! I swear by Al-Khunnas.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But nay! I swear by the stars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No! I swear by the slinkers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Oh, but I call to witness the planets,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: I swear by the receding stars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: I swear by the receding stars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So I swear by the stars that return,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So verily I call to witness the planets - that recede,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So verily, I swear by the planets that recede (i.e. disappear during the day and appear during the night).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Rather, I swear by the returning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So I swear by the retreating stars -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:15] So I swear (fa-lā: lā is extra) by the receding [planets],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Oh, but I call to witness) He says: I swear by (the planets) which appear at night and disappear during the day,
